alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 08 at 3:15AM AKST until November 10 at 4:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Northeast winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. Rapid reductions in visibility from blowing snow are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Numerous snow showers are also expected in this time period and would create even further reductions in visibility within any snow shower.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
